2401.definition: [Ἰδουμαία] of Hebrew origin ({{H123}}); Idumæa (i.e. Edom), a region East (and South) of Palestine

2402.definition: [ἱδρώς] a strengthened form of a primary idos (sweat); perspiration

2403.definition: [Ἰεζαβήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{H348}}); Jezabel (i.e. Jezebel), a Tyrian woman (used as a synonym of a termagant or false teacher)

2404.definition: [Ἱεράπολις] from {{G2413}} and {{G4172}}; holy city; Hierapolis, a place in Asia Minor

2405.definition: [ἱερατεία] from {{G2407}}; priestliness, i.e. the sacerdotal function

2406.definition: [ἱεράτευμα] from {{G2407}}; the priestly fraternity, i.e. sacerdotal order (figuratively)

2407.definition: [ἱερατεύω] prolongation from {{G2409}}; to be a priest, i.e. perform his functions

2408.definition: [Ἱερεμίας] of Hebrew origin ({{H3414}}); Hieremias (i.e. Jermijah), an Israelite

2410.definition: [Ἱεριχώ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3405}}); Jericho, a place in Palestine

2411.definition: [ἱερόν] neuter of {{G2413}}; a sacred place, i.e. the entire precincts (whereas {{G3485}} denotes the central sanctuary itself) of the Temple (at Jerusalem or elsewhere)

2412.definition: [ἱεροπρεπής] from {{G2413}} and the same as {{G4241}}; reverent

2414.definition: [Ἱεροσόλυμα] of Hebrew origin ({{H3389}}); Hierosolyma (i.e. Jerushalaim), the capitol of Palestine Compare {{G2419}}.

2415.definition: [Ἱεροσολυμίτης] from {{G2414}}; a Hierosolymite, i.e. inhabitant of Hierosolyma

2418.definition: [ἱερουργέω] from a compound of {{G2411}} and the base of {{G2041}}; to be a temple-worker, i.e. officiate as a priest (figuratively)

2419.definition: [Ἱερουσαλήμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3389}}); Hierusalem (i.e. Jerushalem), the capitol of Palestine Compare {{G2414}}.

2420.definition: [ἱερωσύνη] from {{G2413}}; sacredness, i.e. (by implication) the priestly office

2421.definition: [Ἰεσσαί] of Hebrew origin ({{H3448}}); Jessæ (i.e. Jishai), an Israelite

2422.definition: [Ἰεφθάε] of Hebrew origin ({{H3316}}); Jephthaë (i.e. Jiphtach), an Israelite

2423.definition: [Ἰεχονίας] of Hebrew origin ({{H3204}}); Jechonias (i.e. Jekonjah), an Israelite

2424.definition: [Ἰησοῦς] of Hebrew origin ({{H3091}}); Jesus (i.e. Jehoshua), the name of our Lord and two (three) other Israelites

2425.definition: [ἱκανός] from ἵκω (ἱκάνω or ἱκνέομαι, akin to {{G2240}}) (to arrive); competent (as if coming in season), i.e. ample (in amount) or fit (in character)

2428.definition: [ἱκετηρία] from a derivative of the base of {{G2425}} (through the idea of approaching for a favor); intreaty

2430.definition: [Ἰκόνιον] perhaps from {{G1504}}; image-like; Iconium, a place in Asia Minor

2431.definition: [ἱλαρός] from the same as {{G2436}}; propitious or merry ("hilarious"), i.e. prompt or willing

2433.definition: [ἱλάσκομαι] middle voice from the same as {{G2436}}; to conciliate, i.e. (transitively) to atone for (sin), or (intransitively) be propitious

2435.definition: [ἱλαστήριον] neuter of a derivative of {{G2433}}; an expiatory (place or thing), i.e. (concretely) an atoning victim, or (specially) the lid of the Ark (in the Temple)

2436.definition: [ἵλεως] perhaps from the alternate form of {{G138}}; cheerful (as attractive), i.e. propitious; adverbially (by Hebraism) God be gracious!, i.e. (in averting some calamity) far be it

2437.definition: [Ἰλλυρικόν] neuter of an adjective from a name of uncertain derivation; (the) Illyrican (shore), i.e. (as a name itself) Illyricum, a region of Europe

2438.definition: [ἱμάς] perhaps from the same as {{G260}}; a strap, i.e. (specially) the tie (of a sandal) or the lash (of a scourge)

2440.definition: [ἱμάτιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi (to put on); a dress (inner or outer)

2442.definition: [ἱμείρομαι] middle voice from ἵμερος (a yearning; of uncertain affinity); to long for

2443.definition: [ἵνα] probably from the same as the former part of {{G1438}} (through the demonstrative idea; compare {{G3588}}); in order that (denoting the purpose or the result) Compare {{G3363}}.

2444.definition: [ἱνατί] from {{G2443}} and {{G5101}}; for what reason ?, i.e. why?

2445.definition: [Ἰόππη] of Hebrew origin ({{H3305}}); Joppe (i.e. Japho), a place in Palestine

2446.definition: [Ἰορδάνης] of Hebrew origin ({{H3383}}); the Jordanes (i.e. Jarden), a river of Palestine

2447.definition: [ἰός] perhaps from εἶμι (to go) or ἵημι (to send); rust (as if emitted by metals); also venom (as emitted by serpents)

2448.definition: [Ἰουδά] of Hebrew origin ({{H3063}} or perhaps {{H3194}}); Judah (i.e. Jehudah or Juttah), a part of (or place in) Palestine

2449.definition: [Ἰουδαία] feminine of {{G2453}} (with {{G1093}} implied); the Judæan land (i.e. Judæa), a region of Palestine

2450.definition: [Ἰουδαΐζω] from {{G2453}}; to become a Judæan, i.e. "Judaize"

2451.definition: [Ἰουδαϊκός] from {{G2453}}; Judaïc, i.e. resembling a Judæan

2452.definition: [Ἰουδαϊκῶς] adverb from {{G2451}}; Judaïcally or in a manner resembling a Judæan

2453.definition: [Ἰουδαῖος] from {{G2448}} (in the sense of {{G2455}} as a country); Judæan, i.e. belonging to Jehudah

2454.definition: [Ἰουδαϊσμός] from {{G2450}}; "Judaism", i.e. the Jewish faith and usages

2455.definition: [Ἰούδας] of Hebrew origin ({{H3063}}); Judas (i.e. Jehudah), the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region

2456.definition: [Ἰουλία] feminine of the same as {{G2457}}; Julia, a Christian woman

2457.definition: [Ἰούλιος] of Latin origin; Julius, a centurion

2458.definition: [Ἰουνιᾶς] of Latin origin; Junias, a Christian

2459.definition: [Ἰοῦστος] of Latin origin ("just"); Justus, the name of three Christian

2460.definition: [ἱππεύς] from {{G2462}}; an equestrian, i.e. member of a cavalry corps

2461.definition: [ἱππικόν] neuter of a derivative of {{G2462}}; the cavalry force

2463.definition: [ἶρις] perhaps from {{G2046}} (as a symbol of the female messenger of the pagan deities); a rainbow ("iris")

2464.definition: [Ἰσαάκ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3327}}); Isaac (i.e. Jitschak), the son of Abraham

2465.definition: [ἰσάγγελος] from {{G2470}} and {{G32}}; like an angel, i.e. angelic

2466.definition: [Ἰσαχάρ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3485}}); Isachar (i.e. Jissaskar), a son of Jacob (figuratively, his descendant)

2467.definition: [ἴσημι] assumed by some as the base of certain irregular forms of {{G1492}}; to know

2468.definition: [ἴσθι] second person imperative present of {{G1510}}; be thou

2469.definition: [Ἰσκαριώτης] of Hebrew origin (probably {{H377}} and {{H7149}}); inhabitant of Kerioth; Iscariotes (i.e. Keriothite), an epithet of Judas the traitor

2470.definition: [ἴσος] probably from {{G1492}} (through the idea of seeming); similar (in amount and kind)

2471.definition: [ἰσότης] likeness (in condition or proportion); by implication, equity

2472.definition: [ἰσότιμος] from {{G2470}} and {{G5092}}; of equal value or honor

2474.definition: [Ἰσραήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3478}}); Israel (i.e. Jisrael), the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants (literally or figuratively)

2475.definition: [Ἰσραηλίτης] from {{G2474}}; an "Israelite", i.e. descendant of Israel (literally or figuratively)

2476.definition: [ἵστημι] a prolonged form of a primary στάω (of the same meaning, and used for it in certain tenses); to stand (transitively or intransitively), used in various applications (literally or figuratively) Compare {{G5087}}.

2477.definition: [ἱστορέω] from a derivative of {{G1492}}; to be knowing (learned), i.e. (by implication) to visit for information (interview)

2479.definition: [ἰσχύς] from a derivative of ἰς (force; compare ἔσχον, a form of {{G2192}}); forcefulness (literally or figuratively)

2480.definition: [ἰσχύω] from {{G2479}}; to have (or exercise) force (literally or figuratively)

2482.definition: [Ἰταλία] probably of foreign origin; Italia, a region of Europe

2483.definition: [Ἰταλικός] from {{G2482}}; Italic, i.e. belonging to Italia

2484.definition: [Ἰτουραΐα] of Hebrew origin ({{H3195}}); Ituræa (i.e. Jetur), a region of Palestine

2487.definition: [ἴχνος] from ἰκνέομαι (to arrive; compare {{G2240}}); a track (figuratively)

2488.definition: [Ἰωάθαμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3147}}); Joatham (i.e. Jotham), an Israelite

2489.definition: [Ἰωάννα] feminine of the same as {{G2491}}; Joanna, a Christian

2490.definition: [Ἰωαννᾶς] a form of {{G2491}}; Joannas, an Israelite

2491.definition: [Ἰωάννης] of Hebrew origin ({{H3110}}); Joannes (i.e. Jochanan), the name of four Israelites

2492.definition: [Ἰώβ] of Hebrew origin ({{H347}}); Job (i.e. Ijob), a patriarch

2493.definition: [Ἰωήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3100}}); Joel, an Israelite

2494.definition: [Ἰωνάν] probably for {{G2491}} or {{G2495}}; Jonan, an Israelite

2495.definition: [Ἰωνᾶς] of Hebrew origin ({{H3124}}); Jonas (i.e. Jonah), the name of two Israelites

2496.definition: [Ἰωράμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3141}}); Joram, an Israelite

2498.definition: [Ἰωσαφάτ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3092}}); Josaphat (i.e. Jehoshaphat), an Israelite

2499.definition: [Ἰωσή] genitive case of {{G2500}}; Jose, an Israelite

2500.definition: [Ἰωσῆς] perhaps for {{G2501}}; Joses, the name of two Israelites Compare {{G2499}}.
